title: Trump administration ends penny production - The Washington Post
---
<p>The roughly 300 billion pennies in circulation remain legal tender, but the Trump administration will stop producing new ones.</p>
<p>PHILADELPHIA — Penny for your thoughts? Check the couch cushions. The U.S. Mint struck its final run of one-cent coins Wednesday, ending more than 230 years of continuous production.</p>
<p class="rw-outer-content"><span>Some content could not be imported from the original document.</span> <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2025/11/13/trump-administration-ends-penny-production/">View content ↗ </a></p><figure></figure>
<figure><img src="https://pl.primis.tech/live/liveView.php?"/></figure>
<figure><img src="https://pl.primis.tech/live/liveView.php?"/></figure>
<figure><img src="https://pl.primis.tech/live/liveView.php?"/></figure>
<figure><img src="https://pl.primis.tech/live/liveView.php?"/></figure>
<p>Treasurer Brandon Beach pressed five commemorative pennies before staff at the Mint, a stone’s throw from Independence Hall, convert the machines to produce nickels, dimes and quarters, in line with President Donald Trump’s <a href="https://truthsocial.com/@realDonaldTrump/posts/113977224933701762">February social media post</a> calling to abolish the penny.</p>
